name: SBOM-dnsmasq-version
description: SBOM component analysis result: dnsmasq version 2.15-OpenDNS-1. The version string is located in the .rodata section of usr/sbin/dnsmasq (offset 0x0000a372). No CVE records were found for this specific version in the NVD database. Note: This is an OpenDNS customized version, it is recommended to check OpenDNS security advisories.
notes: configuration_load

name: SBOM-minidlna-version
description: SBOM component analysis result: minidlna version 1.0.25. Version string was identified within the binary file. Dependency library version information could not be determined through static analysis. Note: This component may be customized for Netgear R6200v2 firmware.
notes: Linked libraries: libpthread.so.0, libexif.so.12, libjpeg.so.7, etc. Library versions could not be determined from static analysis. Analysis limitations: Unable to determine exact versions of linked libraries.

name: SBOM-OpenSSL-version
description: SBOM component analysis result: OpenSSL version 1.0.0g (18 Jan 2012). Version string found in lib/libssl.so. Multiple high-risk CVEs identified: CVE-2014-0224 (CCS injection, CVSS 7.4), CVE-2010-4180 (cipher suite downgrade), CVE-2010-3864 (heap overflow). Although the exact version 1.0.0g is not explicitly mentioned in CVE descriptions, it belongs to the 1.0.0 series and should be considered as affected. Recommendation: Upgrade to the latest secure version.
notes: configuration_load

name: SBOM-MiniDLNA-version
description: SBOM component analysis result: MiniDLNA version 1.0.25. The version information was identified in string constants within the ./usr/sbin/minidlna.exe file, including 'Version 1.0.25' and 'ReadyDLNA/1.0.25'. It is recommended to examine known vulnerabilities for this version, particularly security flaws related to media servers.
notes: It is recommended to check for known vulnerabilities in MiniDLNA version 1.0.25, particularly security vulnerabilities related to the media server.

name: SBOM-BusyBox-version
description: SBOM component analysis result: BusyBox version 1.7.2 (built on 2017-01-10). Version string 'BusyBox v1.7.2 (2017-01-10 11:53:04 CST)' was identified in the binary through static string analysis. No CVE records were found for this specific version in the NVD database, but this version is outdated (released in 2017) and may contain unpatched vulnerabilities from earlier versions. It is recommended to upgrade to a newer version for improved security.
notes: While no specific CVEs were found for version 1.7.2, this older version may contain unpatched vulnerabilities. An upgrade is recommended.
